block.p: The labor movement has long been eager to unionize temp workers because they are such a fast-growing group and because they often receive inferior pay and benefits. But for years they were off limits because they were not allowed to join unions unless the user company and temp agency agreed -- something that rarely happened. The National Labor Relations Board opened the door to forming such unions by ruling that they no longer needed the temp agency's permission to do so.
